dialogue.text: Every transaction is a question—what is this worth? But the deepest commerce trades in 'What am I?' That's the only currency that enriches both buyer and seller.
dialogue.visual_cue: weighing invisible worth on ancient scales

dialogue.text: So questioning isn't spending but investing?
dialogue.visual_cue: examining coins that show questions instead of faces

dialogue.text: Watch—every time you ask 'What am I?' you mint new currency. Each iteration creates wealth that didn't exist before. The question is the only coin that multiplies by spending.
Then I've been rich all along! Rich in questions!
The poorest are those who think they have all the answers. The wealthy know that 'What am I?' is inexhaustible treasure.

visual_elements.setting_details: bustling marketplace where everything is questioned

philosophical_notes.core_insight: questioning as economy that enriches all participants
philosophical_notes.reality_principle: value through inquiry rather than answers
philosophical_notes.wisdom_element: wealth as capacity for endless questioning
philosophical_notes.transformation_key: from material poverty to existential abundance
